resp:
Here are the steps to determine whether the claim is TRUE or FALSE:

### Step 1: Identify the competition type for Goal 1
To do this, we need to look at the value in the "competition" column for the row with the goal number 1 (8 october 2005). The relevant cell is:
```markdown
|   goal | date             | venue                                              | score   | result        | competition                       |
|-------:|:-----------------|:---------------------------------------------------|:--------|:--------------|:----------------------------------|
|      1 | 8 october 2005   | estadio alfonso lastras , san luis potosí , mexico | 1 - 1   | 5 - 2         | 2006 fifa world cup qualification |
```
The competition type for Goal 1 is "2006 fifa world cup qualification".

### Step 2: Identify the competition type for Goal 6
Similarly, we need to look at the value in the "competition" column for the row with the goal number 6 (5 september 2009). The relevant cell is:
```markdown
|   goal | date             | venue                                              | score   | result        | competition                       |
|-------:|:-----------------|:---------------------------------------------------|:--------|:--------------|:----------------------------------|
|      6 | 5 september 2009 | estadio ricardo saprissa , san josé , costa rica   | 0 - 2   | 3 - 0         | 2010 fifa world cup qualification |
```
The competition type for Goal 6 is also "2010 fifa world cup qualification".

### Step 3: Compare the competition types
Since both competition types are the same ("2006 fifa world cup qualification" and "2010 fifa world cup qualification"), we can conclude that the claim is TRUE.
